fields.description:
h3. Summary: 
GreenHopper appears to over-rank issues as described in the below steps. This could be avoided resulting in a potential better usage of GreenHopper

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
Look at the attached screenshots.
* Board 1 containing the all issues in the below order
** PRJ-1
** PRJ-2
** PRJ-3
** PRJ-4
** PRJ-5
* Board 2 containing
** PRJ-1
** PRJ-4
** PRJ-5
* When PRJ-5 is prioritized above PRJ-4, it sits all the way above below PRJ-1.

(i) Pictures speak better than words, the attached screenshots explains this better.

h3. Expected Results:
* The expectation is that PRJ-5, sits just above PRJ-4 and below PRJ-3
fields.summary: As a User, the 'over' ranking done by GreenHopper should be avoided

fields.description:
The Classic task board easily fits twice as many cards.

And with the extra spacing the Rapid Board is still a lot harder to distinguish cards. The exploded UI offers little benefit.

Different teams/boards will likely desire a different degree of compactness.

Suggestions for a more compact UI:
 - customisable font, the rapid board's font is unnecessarily larger than classic boards and there seems no way to change this,
 - customisable card height, for example specified in number of text lines, required height would often be configured proportional to number of columns,
 - remove days in progress dots, not wanted and waste of screen for some teams
 - configure issue links to go to normal jira issue page, completely disabling the greenhopper issue details view,
 - configure individual columns to hide sub-tasks, for example sub-tasks in the "To Do" column may need not be visible and therefore save a lot of screen UI.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user i would like a compact UI displaying as many cards as the classic board can

fields.description: To increase the overview on an agile board in work view with many sub-tasks we configured it to show stories as swimlanes. Unfortunately we can't see the status of stories without opening it. Would it be possible to show the status as some kind of a box placed in the headline bar of the lane. By moving this box to a different column the status of the story would change just like sub-tasks.
fields.summary: As a GH User I want to see the status of a story and directly change it if it is shown as a swimlane

fields.description: We have a lot of sub-tasks which affect the overview in the work view of the agile board. It would be nice to be able to collapse stories and hide all related sub-tasks in all columns to improve the overview and accellerate the work within the daily scrum meeting.
fields.summary: As a GH User I want to collapse stories and hide all sub-tasks to have a better overview in the working board

fields.description:
With the ability to mark epics as Done, it is now possible that users will see an Epic Name lozenge in the Backlog and not be able to see the epic in the panel that this name refers to.

The lozenge on the Issue Detail View should contain a link to the epic's Epic Report.

fields.description:
Hi Rosie,

In 6.1 we will have the ability to mark epics as "done" -- see GHS-6372.

Out of the box, there is no way to re-open an epic. However this can be achieved by following these steps:

# Add the *Epic Status* field to the View and Edit screen of your project
# View the epic in JIRA
# Edit the issue and choose Epic Status as *Open*

Could you please make sure this is documented for the 6.1 release?

Thanks,
fields.summary: Please document how to re-open an epic once it has been marked as Done

fields.description:
h3. Summary: 
Deletion of a filter that is associated with a Rapidboard causes the Rapidboard to disappear from the Agile menu as well as the Manage boards.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Create a rapid board
# Delete the filter associated with the board from JIRA
# The board disappears from the Agile Menu and Manage Boards page.

h3. Expected Results:
# The board should be still be present in Manage boards and when GH detects that it is not having the associated filter, it should request the owner of the board to re-associate it with a filter or with project(s)

h3. Actual Results:
# The board disappears from the Agile Menu and Manage Boards page.

h3. Regression:
NA

h3. Notes:
At the same time the board related data is still available in the database.

h3. Workaround
{panel:title=Workaround}
Refer the article - https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Boards+Are+Not+Visible+After+the+Filter+is+Deleted
{panel}
fields.summary: Deletion of the Filter Associated with a Board Removes the Board

fields.description:
It would be great to have individual burndown charts on GreenHopper.

*Feedback* from a customer,

{quote}
Is there such a function in Jira as an individual burndown chart? Jira support asked that I give feedback to GH support since there is no individual burndown chart. There is much value in an individual burndown chart for the dev team and for the product team as well. It would give me a better gage of how much projected work per sprint is being accomplished per person and would allow me to make adjustments accordingly. Also many of the devs have been inquiring of seeing their own burndown chart to see how they are resolving tasks per sprint and what is not getting resolved when applicable. It looks like this was a past feature from reading in support forums but not one available with the new boards?

Is there an alternate way to allow devs to view their progress each sprint that is not manual?

Thanks
{quote}
fields.summary: Individual burndown charts needed

fields.description:
We have built up a hierachy of issues types "Feature", "User Story" and "Story Task" - with custom coding for automatic issue links, status synchronization, custom field inheritance, effort accumulation and reporting. 2,000 users worldwide.

The feature "Simplified Workflows" (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+GreenHopper+Simplified+Workflow) would break our complete process rules and reporting infrastructure. therefore we need to be sure, that GreenHopper remains fully functional and consistent without "Simplified Workflows".

The UI must not have any references to "Simplified Workflows" in this case.

The release functionality is dangerous for projects which manage releases using scrum boards and other tasks using kanban boards.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6675].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The Reports generated by JIRA Software/JIRA Agile do not allow for the sorting of issues and appear in a random order. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a feature to sort the issues by various fields common to the issues that are displayed in the report.
 
h3. Workaround
No workaround is possible on the report, however one can use the "View in Issue Navigator" and use JQL queries to sort the issues accordingly. 

h3. Original Requst
Would like the option to sort charts on the Rapid Bord by column type.
fields.summary: Sort options for Rapid Board chart data tables

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to clear issues in the done column is by releasing a version.

An administrator should be able to configure the board to have more than one "Clearing" criteria (applied on top of board filter) and a corresponding "Clearing Action".  

Options could be:
 - Release a version (the current functionality)
 - Close all resolved issues
 - (not sure if there are others, but I could see that being the case)

This is important for issues and queues which do not involve software releases, but may exist in a project where releases do happen.  

For example I have tasks (issue-types such as task, technical task, etc) which are managed as a process queue in kanban.  

In the same project, I have release items (issue-types such as Story, Improvement, Feature, Bug) which are managed as a software release process in scrum.  I differentiate between the two using the board filters on issue-type since these may be in the same project.  

Under current functionality, a release from the kanban board will create a release and interfere with the scrum (real releases) process.
fields.summary: As a Kanban user, I'd like to be able to clear items from the board without releasing a version

fields.description: Kanban configuration:swimlanes allows "stories (subtasks)" option when subtasks is disabled in jira
fields.summary: Kanban configuration:swimlanes allows "stories (subtasks)" option when subtasks is disabled in jira

fields.description:
It would be great to have a feature to rank sub-tasks in the Rapid Boards in GreenHopper. One such use case for this would be, in some occasions, the parent issue is not shown on the board but its sub-tasks are shown.

Due to this, the sub-task could not be ranked as it is still bounded to the "hidden" parent issue.

This can be shown in the attached video.
fields.summary: As a GreenHopper User, it would be Good to be Able to Rank Sub-Tasks in Boards

fields.description:
For agile boards, there exists a report mode. In this report mode I can see my open and my last finished sprint report. However, this is not enough.

As a product manager I need to be able to access and see more sprint reports, i.e. all for my current release. 

It would be nice if I could configure how many old reports I'd like to see there or how many sprints back or how many sprints back based on a date/time difference from today in the past.

I then want to see those old sprint reports in the combobox, select and display them.
fields.summary: Save more sprint reports for retrospective

fields.description:
With the introduction of inline editing of many text fields for JIRA 5.1,
I would like to see this in more places.

E.g. in the Plan mode of a Scrum board, I can enter comments by pressing the Comment button. But this results in a modal popup. I would prefer to use inline editing here.
fields.summary: As a scrum board user, I would like to be able to edit the comments inline in the detailed view of Plan mode

fields.description:
When enabling the Epic support for Scrum Board, we will get a panel listing all of the Epic associated to the board. And with this, we can drag and drop issues listed in Backlog to Epics as needed. 

However, if all issues mapped to the Epic is already completed, and the Epic itself is closed in JIRA, apparently the Epic will still listed in the board. And furthermore, we are still able to drag and drop issues to a closed Epic. 

Sample screenshot illustrating the behavior:
!scshot1.png!

!scshot2.png!

This may cause some confusion when using the Scrum board, hence it will be great if Closed Epics are removed from the Scrum board.
fields.summary: Epics will remain in Scrum Board although when the issue is already closed

fields.description:
COS:
- Rename any existing instances of the field to Epic Name
- Rename the type of the field to Epic Name
- Ignore any change items that were previously created against this field
- Search for any references to "Epic Label" and replace them with "Epic Name" -- including documentation (cc: [~rosie@atlassian.com])

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What if there is a duplicate named field?
A: (x) This could cause unexpected results but [~miruflin] states we can't do much about this. Deemed unlikely and an extreme edge case.

Q: What if there is a field type for this already in the system?
A: (x) This could cause unexpected results but [~miruflin] states we can't do much about this. Deemed unlikely and an extreme edge case.

Q: What about existing quick filters or swimlanes (any JQL) that reference the field name?
A: (x) JQL will become invalid, same as any JQL made on a field where the name is changed. Swimlanes/QF would be using Epic Link though since the parent's value is not available.
fields.summary: Change Epic Label field to Epic Name

fields.description:
For active sprints, upcoming sprints and the backlog we currently we only show a message inside the container when its contents are affected by a filter and no issues remain.
The filter can be one or more of Instant Filter, Quick Filter(s), Epic Filter.
For the sprints there are counts showing visible issues e.g. 3/11 Visible Issues, but not for the backlog.

To help users realise there are filters affecting the contents of each container and assist with the removal of any filtering we will add an icon to any filtered container. The title attribute (tooltip) will contain a message in the format "32 Issues filtered. Click to clear all filters."
Clicking the icon will reset all filters on the board including all Quick Filters, Epic Filters and the Instant Filter. If the Instant Filter was active then its contents would be removed as it is reset.

*Stretch* Additionally while we are making the issue count available to the backlog container  we will show the current issue count on the backlog header.

See linked EAC page for sketch.

---

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What happens when you apply instant filters? Is the field cleared as well?
A: (x) Needs to clear value

Q: What happens if you have issues selected?
A: (x) Should not change selection

Q: What happens to any open dropdowns when this button is clicked?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: Do these buttons only clear filters for 1 sprint, or all? If not all, how would we display which filters are active for which sprints?
A: (x) Needs to be for all

Q: What if Epic filters are on but the panel is closed?
A: (x) Needs to clear epic filter
fields.summary: Put 'Filtered' icon at top of backlog and in each sprint header, clicking it clears all filters
Convert Epic progress bars to one progress bar and a broken out key value pair for unestimated stories

fields.description:
Config returns to either columns or filter depending on some old logic that makes little sense.
Change to arrive at filter tab unless a previous visit to the config has occurred and if it has then take the user back there, it's likely they're tweaking the same thing.
Per board setting.
fields.summary: As a user I want to return to the previous configuration tab I used so I can configure my boards more efficiently

fields.description:
When the error messages were updated to JIRA style this one became a dialog but it should be in the content of the page.

This is for a valid URL that user or anon does not have permission to see.
fields.summary: Login message to be in page instead of dialog

fields.description:
In Control Charts, currently, the issue history is utilized and the time spent in transitions are used for calculating the data and plotting the diagram. 

At the moment there is no possibility to see or find out the individual issues that are contributing to the control chart other than hovering the mouse over each dot.

Like we do for the Burndown chart in Scrum, it will be benefical to have a table of issues, sorted in the order of date in which the events appear (the same order in which Control chart calculates the values).

Current system of hovering the mouse over an issue is tedious and error prone.

(!) This request also is due to the fact that currently, when two issues happen to be on the same spot in the Control Chart, there is no way to find out that there are two issues at that location by hovering the mouse over it.
fields.summary: As a user I need the details of the issues that are used for the Control Chart calculation

The issue is that the other *sprint* event dates (you can see them at the bottom of the screenshot listed as event type *Scope change*) cannot be modified anywhere. It will be useful if there is a feature introduced that allows users to be able to modify these dates.

fields.description:
h3. Summary: 

Non-working days are not being respected in the Classic Chart Board.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Set the JVM timezone to {{America/Sao_Paulo}}.
# Create a Chart Board.
# Manually set a NWD.
# It will not be used.

h3. Expected Results:

The NWD is not displayed.

h3. Actual Results:

The NWD is displayed.

h3. Regression:

Unsure of any regression.

h3. Notes:

This is caused by a known bug in JIRA, [JRA-19533|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-19533] and is being tracked there.
fields.summary: Manually added non-working days are still displayed in the Classic Chart Board

fields.description:
COS: 
- Show change history every time a new issue is attached or detached from the Epic
- When multiple issues are attached to an epic at once log just one change history entry
- When multiple issues are detached from an epic at once log just one change
- Can't use the Epic Link field (because that's always from Child to Parent)

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Which events are tracked in the history? Are there any special events for issues that are either not tracked or different for epics?
A: Just adding / removing issues, no special events.

Q: Can you backdate changes?
A: No

Q: What happens to the change history for completing an epic and reopening it?
A: History of added / removed issues shouldn't be affected.

Q: What happens to the change history when estimating stories in that epic?
A: Nothing

fields.description:
Click on add story to epic, then choose a project that is not on the board. You're greeted with an error when creating the issue.

The problem is that we try to reuse the issue loaded from the backlog in order to assign it to the epic. This does not work if the issue won't appear on the board!

Split the logic to separately fetch issue types after creating the issues and use that information to assign the issues to the epic. THEN reload the backlog.
fields.summary: Creating an issue through "Add story to epic" that isn't on the board results in NPE

fields.description:
If you assign an issue with estimate to an epic and then resolve the issue, the epic isn't updated accordingly.

We currently check whether the issue is assigned to the epic and if so update the epic panel. We also have to update the epic panel if the issue isn't on the board anymore
fields.summary: Epic Panel not updating when resolving an issue

fields.description:
When a user first drags an issue vertically (thus reranks) before transitioning the rerank and transition operations happen in parallel.

If on the serve the transition operation happens in the middle of the rerank operation then it can happen that the index won't contain the status change information. The result is that the issue will show up in an incorrect column.

Fix is to not execute the rank operation when initiating a transition operation, which we already do on Plan mode.
fields.summary: Work mode concurrent transition/rank operation can result in incorrect reindexing

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: What if issues are removed and readded to an epic?
A: the report represents current state only

Q: What happens to the table if there are negative estimates?
A: same thing as sprint report

Q: What if the epic is visible on the board, does not contain any issues on that board, but contains issues from another project? What will be displayed in the table?

fields.description:
COS: 
- For a given epic return the history of all issues added and removed (with time) from the Epic
- Will need to inform admins that they need to re-index
- This does not involve the addition of JQL to assist in this querying

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: I'm assuming this will only be seen on the view issue page?
A: It won't be seen in the UI anywhere. It will only be seen by accessing the URL directly. 

Q: What if the epic has been deleted?
A: You get an error message: issue does not exist. 

Q: What if the epic was converted to an issue/subtask?
A: It doesn't check. If you changed it in JIRA and there are still epic child links, you'll still see the data.

Q: What if the linked issue was moved/converted/deleted?
A: It should still show up in the appropriate group (incomplete, complete, punted)

Q: From what version forward will we be tracking this history? aka if an epic link already existed before we introduce this change?
A: previous epic links should be tracked

Q: Do any of these questions surprise you? If so, what hadn't you previously considered?
A: the first one, because it's not a UI story

Q: What else can you think of?
A: (x) Not Answered

fields.description:
As seen in our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Setting+Up+a+Version+Hierarchy], in GreenHopper Classic mode one can handle a hierarchy of fixVersions and charts based on them (since the essence of the Sprint is bound to the fixVersion field). This is a good enough tool to plan releases, see the trend of burning rate, able to predict a release date.

However, in the [GreenHopper Rapid Board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Creating+a+Board], all work is organized in [Sprints|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Creating+a+Sprint], completely independent from the Project Version.

The current [workaround|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/42933/release-planning-in-rapid-board] is to create independent Rapid Boards. However, it would be nice if this could be an embedded feature in GreenHopper next versions.
fields.summary: Rapid Board to handle release planning.
